commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hanamaru, what are you doing?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Getting ready to birdwatch, zura. I brought the book and binoculars, so I might as well use them.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Too bad the bird Eli found flew away. They're surprisingly hard to find when you're actually looking for them. It's almost like they appear out of the blue.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yeah. It's especially difficult because of all the trees here. You could probably find a big bird, but the little ones will be hidden by all the twigs and leaves.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: That's why you have to listen carefully to the sounds around you, zura. The wind, the rustling of the trees, the rush of the river... That's where being a birdwatcher starts!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Ears, not eyes, huh? I see! Let me try. I'm gonna pinpoint a hidden little birdie's voice!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Umi, what are you looking at?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: A map of the mountain. We didn't run that far, so the trail should be close by.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What a relief! Actually, if you find a water symbol on there, it could be this area.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Right. Once I figure out where we are, it'll be easy to determine which way to go. We'll find our way back to the trail and restart our hike!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: That was so much fun! Those birds were adorable, zura.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: When you really try, you can spot quite a few of them.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Hanamaru! Kanata! I figured out how to get back to the trail. We've had enough time to rest. Let's get going.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Whew. We're going to make it back after all.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Huh? Wasn't Yoshiko with you, Kanata?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Huh? I thought she was with you.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Arrrrgh! Why did this have to happen right as I found the way back?! How long has Yoshiko been missing?!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: U-Umm... She was here when we were drinking tea. After that, I think she was messing around near the river. No, wait, maybe she went further into the forest...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Great. If we go the wrong way looking for her, we'll never find our way back to the trail.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: This is ridiculous. Yoshiko, where are you?!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: My name isn't Yoshiko! It's YOHANE!

commands.speaker: Umi, Hanamaru, Eli
commands.line: There she is!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: There's no need to bemoan my absence, little demons. Yohane will always be near her servants in their hour of need!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: You weren't near just now. Where'd you go?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I went to greet the gods of this area. Even an exalted fallen angel such as myself must mind her manners. One must announce oneself before setting foot in another's territory.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Yoshiko. I trust you've got something else to say?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Eeeek! I-I-I'm sorry I ran off by myself!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Hmm? Yoshiko, there's something on your shirt. It looks like a flower petal.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Oh, yeah! There's something I wanna show you all. Follow me!
